situation.name: 인사
step: How are you?
I'm fine. Thank you
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
How are you? 대신에 How are you today?
How are you this morning?도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How was your weekend?
Just fine. Thank you. How about you?
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
위 답변 대신에 Pretty good. And you? 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: Did you have a nice evening?
Couldn't be better
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
Couldn't be better 대신에 I'm feeling well.
Things are going well 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: That's a nice suit
Thank you. You too
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
That's a nice suit.
대신에 That's a nice dress도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How are you?
Nothing special
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적이지도 부정적이지도 않은 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
Nothing sepcial 대신에 Same as always.
Not bad. Busy as usual.도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How are you?
Not too good. I have a bad cold
Tha's too bad. I hope you will get better soon
Thank you
situation.explain:
매일 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
부정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
Not too good 대신에 Could be better.
Couldn't be worse. 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How are you there days?
Pretty good
situation.explain:
가끔 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
How are things?도 사용해보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: What's up?
Pretty good.
situation.explain:
가끔 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
What's new with you?
What are you up to? 도 사용해보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How's business?
I'm great
situation.explain:
가끔 만나는 사이에서 인사할 때,
긍정적인 답변을 할 때 사용합니다.
How's everything도 사용해보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: Long time no see!
How have you been?
I've been pretty busy
Oh, have you?
The days go so quickly
situation.explain:
오랜만에 만난 사람과 대화하는 상황입니다.
How have you been 대신에
How's everything 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: Hi, how have you been doing?
Hi, I have been doing great
It's good to bet back to school again
situation.explain:
오랜만에 만난 사람과 대화하는 상황입니다.
It's been a while 대신에
It's been a long time.
Long time no see. 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: How do you do?
Nice to meet you
I've heard a lot about you
I've been wanting to meet you for a long time
situation.explain:
오랜만에 만난 사람과 대화하는 상황입니다.
Nice to meet you 대신에 I'm glad to meet you.
It's an honor to make your acquaintance. 도 써보세요.

situation.name: 인사
step: Aren't you Mr. Harry?
What a surprise to meet you here!
What brings you this way?
I'm here for shopping
situation.explain:
뜻밖에 장소에서 만난 해리와 대화하는 상황입니다.
'그냥 지나가던 길이예요'라고 말하고 싶으면
I'm just passing through라고 해보세요.

situation.name: 안부
step: How's your sister? Say hello to her for me
Of course, I will
Thank you
korean: 동생은 잘 있어요? 그녀에게 안부를 전해주세요
situation.explain:
동생의 안부를 대신 묻는 상황입니다.
Say hello to her 대신에
Tell her I said hello. 라고 해보세요.

situation.name: 소개
step: Harry this is Tom, Tom this is Harry
I'm glad to meet you, Harry
Glad to meet you, too
korean: 해리야 얘는 톰이야. 톰, 얘는 해리야.
situation.explain:
해리와 톰에게 서로를 소개하는 상황입니다.
남을 소개할 때,
Let me introduce Harry to you도 써보세요.

situation.name: 소개
step: Where are you from?
I'm from America

situation.name: 소개
step: Where are you born?
I was born in Busan
situation.explain:
어디에서 태어났는지 물어보는 상황입니다.
was born in처럼 수동태로 쓴 것을 기억하세요.

situation.name: 헤어질 때
step: Please keep in touch
Ok. You too

situation.name: 헤어질 때
step: It's getting late. I must be going now
Must you go so soon?
Yes..
Can't you stay a little longer?
I'm afraid not. Thanks for inviting me
Bye. I've enjoyed talking with you

situation.name: 날씨
step: What a hot day!
Yes, there's hardly any wind today
korean: 그러게요. 오늘은 바람 한 점 없네요.

situation.name: 날씨
step: What's the weather like today?
It's very cold
Be sure to have your scarf wrapped tightly around your neck.
situation.explain:
날씨에 대해 물어보는 상황입니다.
마지막 문장이 끝나고 Otherwise, you'll catch a cold
(그렇지 않으면 감기에 걸릴 거야)
라고 한마디 붙여주면 좋아요.

situation.name: 날씨
step: How's the weather today?
It's hot and sunny
I can't stand the heat any more
Me, either
When is it going to rain? We haven't had rain for weeks
korean: 이 더위를 더 이상 참을 수 없어
언제쯤 비가 오려나? 몇 주 째 비가 안 오고 있어

situation.name: 계절
step: Which season do you like most?
I like summer
Why do you like summer?
It's because I can enjoy swimming

situation.name: 계절
step: What can we do in spring?
We can go on a picnic
korean: 우리는 봄에 무엇을 할 수 있어요?
situation.explain: 해당 계절에 할 수 있는 것에 대해 물어보는 상황입니다.

situation.name: 계절
step: It's very cold today, isn't it?
Yes, it's cold enough to snow.
I hope we'll have lots of snow this winter so that we can go skiing
So do I
korean: 올해는 눈이 많이 오면 좋겠어요. 그러면 스키를 탈 수 있을 테니까요.
situation.explain:
계절에 대해 말하는 상황입니다.
마지막 문장이 어려우니 다시 한번 읽어보세요.

situation.name: 가족
step: How many people are there in your family?
There are three people in my family. Father, mother and me

situation.name: 가족
step: Do you have any sisters or brothers?
Yes, I do. I have two brothers

situation.name: 가족
step: How old is your nephew, two or three?
He's three
korean: 네 조카는 몇 살이니, 두 살이야 아니면 세 살이야?
situation.explain:
가족의 나이 대해 물어보는 상황입니다.
He is three years old도 써보세요.

situation.name: 초대
step: When is your birthday?
It's May 19th, this Saturday
situation.explain:
특별한 날에 대해 물어보는 상황입니다.
날짜를 표시하는 단어들에 대해서 알아보세요.

situation.name: 초대
step: Hello
Hi, come in. Glad to meet you
Thanks for inviting me
My pleasure
korean: 안녕, 어서 들어와. 만나게 돼서 반가워.

situation.name: 초대
step: Have a seat please. Just make yourself at home
Thanks
Can I get you something to drink?
No thanks

situation.name: 초대
step: I just received the invitation to your birthday party
Do you think you can make it?
I'd love to but I'm not sure I can. Let me check and get back to you.
Okay. I hope you can make it. Bye
korean: 방금 네 생일 파티 초대장을 받았어
그러고 싶지만, 갈 수 있을지 확실하지가 않다. 확인해서 알려 줄게.
그래, 올 수 있으면 좋겠다. 그럼 안녕.

situation.name: 초대
step: Can you come over for lunch this Sunday?
I'm sorry I can't. I have a prior engagement.
That's fine. Some other time.
Thanks anyway.
korean: 이번 주 일요일 점심 먹으러 우리 집에 올래?
situation.explain: 초대를 받은 상황에서 거절하는 대화 상황입니다.

situation.name: 선물
step: Happy birthday! This is for you
Thank you so much. May I open it?
Sure. Go ahead
Oh, it's so lovely. Thanks

situation.name: 선물
step: Who is this box of chocolate for?
This is for you. Happy Valentine's Day.
Oh, you are so sweet. Thank you.

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: Do you have many friends?
Yes, I do
situation.explain:
교우 관계에 대해 묻는 상황입니다.
부정으로 답하고 싶으면 No, I don't라고 하면 됩니다.

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: What time is your first class?
At 9 o'clock

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: What's your favorite subject?
I like social studies
You like science, don't you?
Of course. I do

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: What do you do after school?
I always do my homework
situation.explain: 방과 후 무엇을 하는지 묻는 상황입니다.

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: I'm playing hooky today
You're skipping school? Seriously?

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: I can't solve the problem.
Neither can I
situation.explain:
공감하는 대화 상황입니다.
Neither can I를 I can't solve, either
이라고 바꿔 말할 수도 있습니다.

situation.name: 시험
step: I passed the English test
Good for you! I got an A on my math test
Good for you!
korean: 잘 됐구나! 난 수학 시험에서 A 맞았어

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: How do you go to school?
I go to school by bus

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: You are late
I'm sorry for being late
Why are you late for class?
My alarm clock was broken, so I missed the bus

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: I'd like to take out 'Harry Potter'
Do you have a library card?
No, I don't.
Then, please fill out this form.
Where is the book?
The book section you want is upstairs and to the right.

situation.name: 학교 생활
step: I'd like to take out 'Aesop's Fables'
The book is out
When is it due back?
Tomorrow afternoon

situation.name: 직업
step: What's your dream?
My dream is to be an athlete.

situation.name: 직업
step: What do you want to be when you grow up?
I want to be a scientist.
I hope your dream will come true.

situation.name: 흥미
step: Does your grandmother wear glasses?
Yes, she does.
situation.explain:
할머니에 대해 대화하는 상황입니다.
부정일 경우 No, she doesn't 하면 됩니다.

situation.name: 흥미
step: How tall are you?
I'm 152 centimeters tall.
situation.explain:
키에 대해 대화하는 상황입니다.
키에 대해 물을 때 How tall로 시작해야 합니다.

situation.name: 흥미
step: What's your hobby?
My hobby is collecting stamps.
How long have you been collecting them?
Since I was fifteen years old
You must have a large collection

situation.name: 흥미
step: How do you spend your leisure time?
I can hardly find free time for myself
What would you like to do if you had free time?
I'd go to the mall and do a lot of window shopping.
korean: 만약 시간 여유가 있다면 무엇을 하고 싶으세요?
쇼핑 센터에 가서 실컷 구경하고 싶어요

situation.name: 흥미
step: Who is your favorite singer?
I like George Michael
Did you ever see one of his concerts?
I once tried to see his concert, but I couldn't get a ticket.
korean: 그 사람의 공연을 본 적이 있나요?
한 번 보려고 했는데, 표를 구하지 못했어요.

situation.name: 흥미
step: What type of music do you like?
I love rock&rall music. What about you?
I like classical music.

situation.name: 흥미
step: How often do you go to the movies?
About twice a week
Wow! You really like movies

situation.name: 흥미
step: Well, here we are at the theater
When does the movie start?
It begins at seven fifteen

situation.name: 흥미
step: What's on television?
The golf tournament is on channel 2.
Change the channel to MBC. I want to see a movie.
No way! This game is really getting exciting.
korean: MBC채널로 돌려, 나 영화 보고 싶어.

situation.name: 흥미
step: Did you see the football game on television last night?
No, who was playing?
The Green Bay Packers and the Dallas Cowboys.
Who won? What was the score?
The Packers beat the Cowboys 27 to 14.

situation.name: 흥미
step: Do you have any hobbies?
Yes, I like reading books.
Do you read a lot?
I spend almost everyday reading a book in the library.
What have you recently read?
I read the fiction navel, 'The Last Leaf'
korean: 거의 매일 도서관에서 책을 읽으며 보내.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: Will you have some more cake?
No, thank you
situation.explain:
음식을 권유하는 상황입니다.
No, thank you 대신에 I'm full.
I've had enough를 사용해보세요.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: We have some chocolate cake
My mouth is watering
Do you need a fork?
No, thanks. I can use chopsticks.
korean: 감사합니다만 저는 젓가락을 사용할 수 있어요.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: What's your favorite food?
My favorite food is pizza
Let's go to the Italian restaurant, shall we?
All right

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: What would you like to have?
Anything. I'm not picky
Have you ever tried Korean food?
Yes, I have.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: How can I help you?
Do you have a table for two?
Sure, this way. Please take a seat. Here is the menu.
korean: 물론입니다. 이쪽으로 앉으시겠습니까? 여기에 메뉴가 있습니다.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: May I take your order?
Well, I'll have this one and this, please
Yes. Would you like something to drink?
One coke and a coffee, please.
Thanks.

situation.name: 음식 & 외식
step: I'd like a cheese burger, a medium drink. Hold the onions on my burger.
Is that for here to go?
To go please.
korean: 치킨 버거 하고 중간사이즈 음료 주세요. 햄버거에 양파는 빼주세요.
여기서 드실 건가요 아니면 갖고 가실 건가요?

situation.name: 운동
step: What sports do you play?
We often play soccer after school
korean: 우리들은 방과 후에 자주 축구를 합니다.

situation.name: 운동 & 다이어트
step: I like basketball. How about you?
My favorite sport is soccer
korean: 난 농구를 제일 좋아하는데, 넌 어때?

situation.name: 운동 & 다이어트
step: It's really hot today
Yeah, do you want to go in the pool and cool off?
That sound like fun, but I don't know how to swim.
You can't swim? It's easy. Come on, I'll teach you
korean: 그래, 수영장에 들어가서 몸 좀 식힐까?
재미있겠지만, 나는 수영 할 줄 몰라
수영을 못한다고? 그것은 쉬워, 내가 가르쳐 줄게

situation.name: 운동 & 다이어트
step: Did you bring something to eat for lunch?
No, I usually skip lunch.
Why?
I am on a diet. I'm a little overweight.
korean: 다이어트 중이야. 몸무게가 좀 많이 나가.

situation.name: 시간
step: What time is it?
It's twelve twenty-five.
situation.explain:
시간을 물어보는 상황입니다.
What time do you have?
Do you have the time?이라고 대신해도 됩니다.

situation.name: 시간
step: Do you have any plans for Saturday?
I'm going to the movies with my friend. Would you like to join us?
Sure, I'd love to. What time can we meet?
Please meet me at twelve o'clock at the flower shop
korean: 친구와 영화를 보러 가요. 같이 갈래요?

situation.name: 물건 사기
step: I don't know what to buy for her.
She likes books.
korean: 나는 그녀를 위해 무엇을 사야 할지 모르겠어.

situation.name: 물건 사기
step: Can you break a twenty?
Sure.

situation.name: 물건 사기
step: May I help you?
No, thank you. I'm just browsing.
situation.explain:
쇼핑하는 상황입니다.
구경한다는 표현에
I'm just looking around도 좋습니다.

situation.name: 물건 사기
step: I'm looking for a dress shirt to do with this jacket.
All our shirts are on the racks over here. How about this one?
That's not bad. Can I try it on?
Certainly. The fitting rooms are over there.
korean: 이 재킷과 어울리는 와이셔츠를 사려고 하는데요.
셔츠는 모두 이쪽 진열대에 있습니다. 이 셔츠는 어떠세요?
괜찮네요. 한번 입어 볼 수 있을까요?

situation.name: 전화
step: Hello. Can I talk to Harry?
This is Harry

situation.name: 전화
step: May I speak to Stephanie?
I'm sorry, but she is tied up right now. Could I take a message?
Yes. Please tell her that Cindy returned her call
Okay

situation.name: 전화
step: Hello. May I speak to Ron, please?
Who's speaking, please?
This is Randy calling
Hi, Randy. This is Rob. What's up?
Let's get together tonight. Can you meet with me at the library at 6:00?
Okay. See you soon.
korean: 안녕 Randy. 나 Rob아야? 무슨 일이야?

situation.name: 전화
step: Hello, Dr. Chang's office
I am calling to make an appointment.
Who is calling, please?
This is Minsoo Kim.
Can you come in next Monday at ten-thirty in the morning?
Yes, I can. Thank you.
You're welcome. See you then.
korean: 다음 주 월요일 아침 10시 30분에 올 수 있나요?

situation.name: 여행 & 관광
step: Have you ever traveled by plane?
Yes. I went to Jeju island by air last fall
How long did it take from Seoul to Jeju?
Only an hour
korean: 비행기 여행을 해 본 적이 있어?

situation.name: 여행 & 관광
step: How long will you stay in America?
I will stay there for a week
korean: 넌 미국에서 얼마나 오랫 동안 머무를 거니?
난 일주일 동안 그곳에 머무를 거야.

situation.name: 여행 & 관광
step: Excuse me, but would you mind taking a picture of us?
Not at all
Just press this button. Can you get the mountain in the background?
Sure. Ready? On the count of three, one, two, three.
korean: 실례하지만, 저희 사진 좀 찍어 주시겠어요?
이 버튼만 누르시면 됩니다. 뒤에 산이 배경으로 나오게 해 주시겠어요?

situation.name: 길 찾기
step: How can I get there?
Go straight two blocks and turn right
korean: 두 블록을 똑바로 간 다음에 오른쪽으로 도세요.

situation.name: 길 찾기
step: Excuse me, ma'am. How can I get to City Hall?
Take bus number 34.
korean: 실례합니다, 선생님. 시청에 가려면 어떻게 해야 합니까?

situation.name: 길 찾기
step: Excuse me. Could you tell me where the nearest bus stop is?
Just over there. You can't miss it
I'd like to go to the city bus. How much will it cost?
The bus fare is ten dollars per person.
korean: 바로 저기 있습니다. 찾기 쉬울 거예요
버스로 시내에 가려고 하는데 요금이 얼마죠?

situation.name: 길 찾기
step: Here we are at the station! Let's get the tickets right away.
Do you know where the ticket office is?
Yes, it's right over there.
korean: 자, 역에 도착했다. 빨리 표를 사자

situation.name: 비행기 타기
step: I'd like to make a reservation for a flight from Seoul to New York on November 23
Just moment. We have a flight leaving Seoul at 10:20 a.m., and arriving in New York at 10:00 p.m. the next day.
Is it nonstop?
Yes.
korean: 11월 23일 서울에서 뉴욕 가는 항공편을 예약하고 싶습니다.
잠시만 기다리세요. 오전 10시20분에 서울에서 출발해서 다음날 오후 10시에 뉴욕에 도착하는 항공편이 있습니다.

situation.name: 비행기 타기
step: Excuse me. Could I please change seats?
Yes, no problem. Would you like an aisle seat or a window seat?
Window seat, please.
korean: 죄송합니다만, 자리 좀 바꾸어 주실 수 있습니까?
네, 가능합니다. 통로 쪽과 창문 쪽 중 어떤 좌석을 원하십니까?

situation.name: 비행기 타기
step: May I see your passport, please?
Yes. Here you are
What's the purpose of your visit?
I'm studying in Australia.

situation.name: 일상 업무
step: I want to send this package
What are the contents?
It contains clothes
Do you want it registered?
Yes, please. How much will it be?
ten dollars
Can I get a money order here, too?
No. You have to go to window three on your right

situation.name: 일상 업무
step: How would you like your hair cut?
I brought a photo. I'd like my hair to look like this picture
No problem. Would you like your hair shampooed?
Yes, please.
korean: 제가 사진을 가지고 왔는데, 이렇게 해주세요.

situation.name: 일상 업무
step: I have a bad toothache
Come this way and sit down here, please. Open your mouth wide, will you?
One of my lower back teeth is killing me.
Yes, this big one is badly decayed. I'm afraid it has to be pulled out.
korean: 이쪽으로 오세요. 여기 앉아서 입을 크게 벌려주세요.
네 큰 어금니가 몹시 썩었군요. 뽑아야겠습니다.

situation.name: 환경
step: Those people are throwing away empty bottles on the street
It's very dangerous
We should recycle the bottles
Then we'll have a clean city
korean: 사람들이 빈 병을 거리에 버리고 있어.
